jobDescription: The HMDA-CRA Data Analyst, Sr. is responsible for ensuring the bank's compliance with the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA) and Community Reinvestment Act (CRA) reporting requirements. The role is accountable for all aspects of the process including, but not limited to, ensuring completeness and accuracy of HMDA/CRA data reported; timely reporting to regulators; timely report generation for the bank's leadership team; promoting organizational awareness; training; and ensuring strategic goals are achieved. Advise executive and line management on emerging risk issues, and assist various business units in establishing policies, procedures and controls to achieve accurate HMDA, HMDA Plus and CRA regulatory reporting.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSMaintain a company-wide regulatory compliance program focused on HMDA and CRA.Provide input on HMDA business regulatory requirements including guidance on best practices, industry standards and procedures.Manage the capturing, maintaining and analyzing of HMDA, HMDA Plus and CRA data, interpreting it to ensure consistency and adequate compliance risk management.Manage annual submission of HMDA and CRA data to ensure accurate and timely filings.Maintain strong partnerships and collaboration with relevant line management to ensure HMDA reporting and CRA reporting requirements are met.Prepare and present reports to management regarding status of compliance in areas of regulatory risk focus and analyzes quality control results to determine areas for improvement.Perform quality assurance on loan applications to ensure HMDA and CRA data is complete and accurate and ensures all errors identified are remediated.Perform targeted tests on lines of business HMDA and CRA controls and provide guidance on identified risks.Deliver subject matter expertise with respect to HMDA, HMDA Plus and CRA reporting requirements and stay abreast of all changes in regulations.Interpret performance analysis reports, documenting the factors that are impacting the bank's performance, and helps develop corrective strategies where needed.Maintains the Banks CRA Public File, ensures it is up-to-date, compliant and available at all branch bank locations via hard copy and electronic version.Support regulatory examinations by federal regulators or other internal or external auditors.Manage and oversee work of HMDA / CRA Data Analysts.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIREMENTSDemonstrated ability to manage and lead team members including consulting, presentation and project management skills.Proven ability regarding complex laws and regulations to line personnel and senior management to analyze, communicate verbally or in writing and make recommendations effectively.Proficient with CRA WIZ, RATA, Compliance Ease or other regulatory reporting software for CRA and HMDA submissions is required.Significant MS Excel and full Office Suite skills desired.Effective time management skillsAbility to interface with all levels of employees and managementTRAINING AND EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree plus 7-10 years of HMDA /CRA data integrity management experience with a mortgage or lending institution is required.
